StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdateMapsSectorZip]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@SectorZipId uniqueidentifier, @SectorID uniqueidentifier, @Zip varchar(5)=NULL, --@LastUpdateDate date.me, @LastUpdateUserId uniqueidentifier
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION declare @e.ec.ve date.me set @e.ec.ve = getdate();
if NOT EXISTS (select * from MapsSectorZipHist where SectorID=@SectorID) set @e.ec.ve = dateadd(year, -2, getdate());
-- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement IF NOT EXISTS(SELECT SectorZipId FROM MapsSectorZip WHERE SectorID=@SectorID and Zip=@Zip)
BEGIN -- if @intCount = 0, then the Employee does not exist. INSERT. INSERT INTO MapsSectorZip (SectorZipId, SectorID, Zip, E.ec.veDate, LastUpdateDate, LastUpdateUserId) VALUES (@SectorZipId, @SectorID, @Zip, @e.ec.ve, GETDATE(), @LastUpdateUserId) END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
